intro: Moehringia bavarica, commonly known as the Bavarian moehringia, is a small, flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes carnations and other flowering plants. The plant produces delicate, white or pink flowers that bloom in early summer. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils. Moehringia bavarica is often found in open, sunny habitats and is adapted to cold climates.
